instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Serial number unavailable
threads.message:
Got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Air on the desk which was turning on intermittently. <CHIP>U1930</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C1930</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R1931</RESISTOR> were corroded. Replaced and unit is booting but does not see serial number. SPI traces all good.
I ordered and replaced the EFI chip which was meant to be pre programmed but still have the same issue. I have since bought a CH341A programmer and I have uploaded the original EFI dump to Google drive [URL='https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ii4hBOdsSUTghy9l7isNIZVPlj2El7sT/view?usp=sharing']here[/URL] Is anyone able to help make it a working EFI so the customer can have serial number again or advise if it could be something else?

Serial number:  C02NT0KBG085
Early 2014 MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Serial number unavailable
threads.message:
Your Fsys area is f***d off; there is no serial number present on your dump.
Tomorrow I will build a new BIOS for you...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Serial number unavailable
threads.message: Thanks very much! is it possible the new EFI just wasn't programmed at all or the FSYS could've been corrupted after updating the new EFI for Catalina etc.?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Serial number unavailable
threads.message:
Some people complained about BIOS corruption after Catalina install...
But I cannot asure the "quality" of BIOS you bought.
Usually online sellers just grab BIOS read from other board; not clean ME, nor serial number really fixed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Serial number unavailable
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Serial number unavailable
threads.message: Thanks [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER], it worked great! this can be marked as fixed.
